fields.name: MATID
fields.help: Material ID defined in *MAT_.

fields.name: ALPHA
fields.help: Excitation constant alpha described in Equation(1).

fields.name: BETA
fields.help: Excitation constant beta described in Equation(2).

fields.name: GAMMA
fields.help: Excitation constant gamma described in Equation(2).

fields.name: C
fields.help: Excitation constant c described in Equation(1).

fields.name: MU1
fields.help: Excitation constant mu1 described in Equation(2).

fields.name: MU2
fields.help: Excitation constant mu2 described in Equation (2).

fields.name: V
fields.help: Initial value of V.

fields.name: R
fields.help: Initial value of r.

fields.name: id
fields.help: ID of the Laplace system to solve (define new id with each new line)

fields.name: partid
fields.help: Part id on which the system is solved

fields.name: stype
fields.help: Segment type: eq = 1: node-set, eq=2: segment-set

fields.name: ssid1
fields.help: Set on which a potential of value 1 is prescribed

fields.name: ssid2
fields.help: Set on which a potential of value 0 is prescribed

fields.name: partsid
fields.help: Part set on which the system is solved

fields.name: solvid1
fields.help: ID of the Laplace system that is solved in the transmural direction

fields.name: solvid2
fields.help: ID of the Laplace system that is solved in the apicobasal direction

fields.name: alpha
fields.help: helical angle with respect to the counterclockwise circumferential direction in the heart when looking from the base towards the apex. If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_â€ŒFUNCTION will be expected. See remark 1- for available parameters

fields.name: beta
fields.help: angle with respect to the outward transmural axis of the heart. If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_â€ŒFUNCTION will be expected. See remark 1- for available parameters

fields.name: wfile
fields.help: Selects whether result files (ELEMENT_SOLID_ORTHO.k and vtk files) are exported. Eq 0: not exported. Eq 1: exported

fields.name: prerun
fields.help: Select whether the run is stopped after creating fibers: Eq. 0: do not stop after fiber creation. Eq 1: stop after fiber creation

fields.name: MID
fields.help: Material ID: refers to MID in the *PART card.

fields.name: MTYPE
fields.help:
Defines the electromagnetism type of the material:
    EQ.0: Air or vacuum 
    EQ.1: Insulator material: these materials have the same electromagnetism behavior as EQ.0
    EQ.2: Conductor carrying a source. In these conductors, the eddy current problem is solved, which gives the actual current density. Typically, this would correspond to the coil.
    EQ.4: Conductor not connected to any current or voltage source, where the Eddy current problem is solved. Typically, this would correspond to the workpiece
.

fields.name: SIGMA11
fields.help: The 1,1 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix. Note that 1 corresponds to the a material direction.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA22
fields.help: The 2,2 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA33
fields.help: The 2,2 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: BETA
fields.help: Surface to volume ratio.

fields.name: CM
fields.help: Membrane capacitance

fields.name: SIGMA12
fields.help: The 1,2 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.Note that 2 corresponds to the b material direction.. If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA13
fields.help: The 1,3 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA21
fields.help: The 2,1 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix. Note that 1 corresponds to the a material direction.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA23
fields.help: The 2,3 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA31
fields.help: The 3,1 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: SIGMA32
fields.help: The 3,2 term in the 3 x 3 electromagnetic conductivity tensor matrix.If a negative value is entered, a *DEFINE_FUNCTION will be expected. See remark 3- for available parameters.

fields.name: AOPT
fields.help:
Material axes option:
 EQ.0.0: locally orthotropic with material axes determined by element nodes
 EQ.1.0:locally orthotropic with material axes determined by a point in space and the global location of the element center this is the a-direction.
 EQ.2.0:globally orthotropic with material axes determined by vectors defined below, as with *DEFINE_COORDINATE_VECTOR. 
 EQ.3.0:locally orthotropic material axes determined by rotating the material axes about the element normal by an angle,BETA, from a line in the plane of the element defined by the cross product of the vector v with the element normal. The plane of a solid element is the midsurface between the inner surface and outer surface defined by the first four nodes and the last four nodes of the connectivity of the element, respectively.
 EQ.4.0:locally orthotropic in cylindrical coordinate system with the material axes determined by a vector v, and an originating point, P, which define the centerline axis. This option is for solid elements only. 
 EQ.5.0:globally defined reference frame with (a,b,c)=(X0,Y0,Z0).

fields.name: LAMBDA
fields.help: Intra- to extracellular conductivity ratio. When non-empty, the elliptic equation is solved to compute extracellular potentials

fields.name: XP
fields.help: Define coordinates of point p for AOPT = 1 and 4.

fields.name: YP
fields.help: Define coordinates of point p for AOPT = 1 and 4.

fields.name: ZP
fields.help: Define coordinates of point p for AOPT = 1 and 4.

fields.name: A1
fields.help: Define components of vector a for AOPT = 2.

fields.name: A2
fields.help: Define components of vector a for AOPT = 2.

fields.name: A3
fields.help: Define components of vector a for AOPT = 2.

fields.name: MACF
fields.help:
Material axes change flag for solid elements: 
 EQ.1: No change, default

fields.name: V1
fields.help: Define components of vector v for AOPT = 3 and 4.

fields.name: V2
fields.help: Define components of vector v for AOPT = 3 and 4.

fields.name: V3
fields.help: Define components of vector v for AOPT = 3 and 4.

fields.name: D1
fields.help: Define components of vector d for AOPT = 2.

fields.name: D2
fields.help: Define components of vector d for AOPT = 2.

fields.name: D3
fields.help: Define components of vector d for AOPT = 2.
